name: Isle of Rook
role_in_state: maritime re-export hub and shipwright outpost
economy_niches: staging point for ritual reagent re-exports
seaweed-based dyes and small coastal crafts
culture_adjustments: clan-patron shipping houses outweigh civic guild authority
high practical tolerance for islander migrants; Island Creole widely spoken
augury rituals are woven into daily port routines and contracts
ancestor-rites emphasize sailors lost at sea over inland lineages
constraints: ritual magic dependent on imported reagents
notes: key pilot station on State_2 coastal routes
local shipwrighting uses layered-timber techniques unique to isle
